verb.description: Make (someone) unable to breathe properly; suffocate.
examples: those in the streets were stifled by the fumes

verb.description: Restrain (a reaction) or stop oneself acting on (an emotion)
examples: she stifled a desire to turn and flee
she gave a stifled cry of disappointment

noun.description: A joint in the legs of horses, dogs, and other animals, equivalent to the knee in humans.
